alert.note: Alert for Chelan; Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 14 at 10:38AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Ongoing snowmelt and additional rainfall from thunderstorms starting Monday will bring additional rises on many rivers and streams in and near the Cascades... Many of the rivers across north-central Washington will experience increased flows through the upcoming week due to a significant amount of melting snow above 4000 feet. In addition, showers and thunderstorms will begin to develop on Monday with the threat continuing though most of the week. These showers and storms will be slow moving and will result in the possibility of rapid rises on some of the smaller creeks and streams in the area. Isolated thunderstorms may also produce localized debris flows in steep terrain, or flash flooding, especially near burn scars.
